HELLO!

I'm Jodi Antonette Calleja, a Sophomore Computer Science student at the University of the Philippines Los Ba√±os (UPLB).

To me, UI is part of the experience, and in every project I create, I move forward with this mindset. I believe that the interface isn't just decoration, it's the bridge between human intention and technological capability. The best code in the world means nothing if users can't navigate it, understand it, or enjoy using it.

Frontend development captivates me because it's the perfect intersection of logic and creativity.

When I step away from my computer, I'm often found at my sewing machine, bringing fictional characters to life through cosplay.
Both coding and costume-making require the same skills. The attention to detail, patience with iteration, and the ability to transform a vision into reality. Whether I'm debugging a responsive layout or hand-stitching a costume detail, I approach each challenge with the same dedication to craftsmanship.

I'm proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, Java, and R, and I use tools like Figma, Adobe After Effects, and VSCode to bring my projects to life.

I'm excited about the opportunity to join Gugil Co. as a Frontend Software Engineer. I want to work on projects that prioritize user experience, where thoughtful design decisions make technology more accessible and enjoyable, I bring not just technical skills, but a genuine passion for creating digital experiences that feel human, intuitive, and beautiful. :3

iReady

An optimization web application for relief planning that utilizes the random forest model to predict typhoon risk levels.

 SmiCS

A Smiski themed registration planner for ICS

 AeroSolve

A frutiger aero inspired planner to reduce pollution while spending the least amount of money using simplex method.
